author: aprilxx37
title: No access to shop
body: All the patients on Carlisle ward have not gone to the zest shop due to having no staff to take us down, we go in two separate groups every Tuesday at 1:30pm we are all not happy we haven't been able to go, please help us, Thank you, from all the patients on Carlisle ward.

author: Sargk58
title: Poor service
body:
Terrible service at Colindale medical centre. Lack of communication between staff, doctors and of course the patients. Expect to add on at least a 45 min wait to your scheduled appointment .  
Happens on a regular basis, poor management and time keeping.

author: robinyd36
title: GP practice unwilling to assist to help manage my endometriosis
body:
I lived in Preston previously until 2016 and then moved to Scotland where I was treated and operated on for endometriosis.  
Upon return to England I been registered with my local GP at Park View medical practice in Preston however my experiences have been upsetting and frustrating. They have refused to request my medical records from my Scottish GP which means that I do not have endometriosis on my medical records. They state that my Scottish GP needs to send these over to them, however they have stated they cannot do this unless Park View formally request them. I have informed Park View of this and they have refused.  
I spoke with a lovely GP at Park View after I have been struggling with my symptoms of endometriosis - I suspect I may have another endometrioma cyst. I am in a lot of in the pelvic region and my back. The GP said that I should go and get bloods done to measure CA125 amongst other things which may help put on a rush for a pelvic scan.  
For the last two weeks, I have had nothing but barriers to get blood tests. My GP practice doesn't have the capacity to book me in for bloods and had to be booked elsewhere to another GP practice which is 40 minutes from home. After arranging time off work and finally finding my way there I was told the appointment was cancelled as the nurse is off sick and that they notified Park View Medical Practice to contact me to cancel. I did not receive any contact whatsoever. I called Park View to ask if I can have blood tests with them as they are nearby, but now I have been sent to somewhere else on a Sunday morning that is much further from home.  
It is not good enough, I have upcoming deadlines with the university and felt I had no option but to book the Sunday when I have so many added pressures. I do not understand why this GP practice is so unwilling to get my medical history and why I am unable to access a simple blood test that would allow the GP and myself more information about what steps to take forward. I am only young and endometriosis has affected me so much and could risk my future fertility. Sharing information and allowing me access to medical treatment is what I need to manage my symptoms. In Scotland I had a gynaecologist and here it seems I am left with nothing and left to be fighting for the basic things.

author: Disheartened and depressed
title: Not easy to book appointments by phone nor online
body:
I was told to phone the practice at 8:00 am to book an appointment. I did phone punctually - waited on the line for over ten minutes - got no response. Hung up then tried again an hour later - still no-one picked up the phone. Repeated process again one hour later - waited well over ten minutes - still no response. I got depressed and gave up trying to book an appointment. Tried using Patient Access online - it didn't have any facility for booking a telephone consultation.  
I feel very disheartened and let down by the lack of response from the practice. They always seem to be under-staffed and the admin staff are not sufficient in number to respond swiftly to the numerous calls. It's poor management. I am very very disappointed.

author: Nothappysam
title: Not taken seriously
body:
We went to the GP constantly for my daughter. We found the doctor quite patronising, and that we were just new parents. We kept explaining that the rashes on our child did not seem normal but they kept saying that it was common. The following day we had to take put child to a&e and they were admitted into hospital on an IV drip for a serious infection.  
Following on we went to the dermatologist who saw the creams that were prescribed. They appeared surprised that a GP would prescribe something like this.

author: R of Shrewsbury
title: Treatment for gonorrhea
body:
After a test result which came back positive for gonorrhea I immediately phoned the Walk in Clinic at Severn Fields. I was told Iâ€™d then be phoned for a consultation on Monday (my test result had came back on the Thursday). I was  phoned on the Monday (which is a call anywhere between 8.30am and 4pm, not easy to take when at work where phones are not allowed), and was given a time the following Saturday. This was a bit too late for me. My partner who was tested at the same time and had their positive result back ten minutes earlier than me; had their antibiotic treatment given at their local centre in Manchester the following day! Mine was to be a more than a week later. I asked for it to be earlier and they gave me a time on the Thursday, a week after calling them. Oh well. 
On the Thursday everything was great, staff were lovely and had bloods taken and other tests and a vaccine given. Appointment booked in two weeks time for retest. 
If it wasnâ€™t for the long wait to be seen and the phone time issue,  Iâ€™d give a perfect score.

author: Nikolas
title: Consultations with knowledgeable Doctor
body:
I consulted Dr Rufus who as always listens carefully and provides extremely caring professional advice and support. Rufus is an absolute go to doctor and I would recommend him to anybody.  
I phage consulted Rufus on numerous occasions over the years heâ€™s been at the practice and heâ€™s very knowledgeable and takes the trouble to follow through with investigations and referrals . Heâ€™s a very good GP and the practice is lucky to have him .

author: jack555
title: My GP wastes no time
body:
Dr Ferrabee has been my general practitioner for a while now since my last GP services closed. I was happy to speak with him on the phone the Wednesday morning; weâ€™ve built a good rapport which I like from my GP.  
I have a long- term health condition and expressed concerns with my GP, he therefore suggested an ultrasound scan on my throat and armpit. Additionally Iâ€™ve have knee and foot pains for a long while now, and I finally through I should speak to my GP about it and get an X-ray. Very simple, compassionate, consistent and engaging Dr Ferrabee wasted no time.

author: Dia369
title: Problems on the ward and moving to hospice care
body:
My brother went into Craigavon Hospital Accident and Emergency Department in the early hours of a Saturday in mid May. He was then admitted to the fourth-floor North ward.  
He had been previously diagnosed with inoperable stage 4 cancer. His wife was told by staff at North Ward that he had barely weeks to live. From the Wednesday he started to suffer severe anxiety to the point where his wife had to stay with him around the clock. She slept on the floor of the room that he was in, whilst her children were being cared for by relatives.  
In less than a week he had developed multiple bedsores which we considered due to lack of attention from medical staff. His wife had to resort to trying to turn her husband on her own.  
She was assured that on the morning of his the day in hospital he would be moved to Newry Hospice.  
The Newry Hospice pastor came to see him to tell that all was prepared for his move to the hospice. When it came to the day he should be moving his wife after waiting sometime, went to inquire why an ambulance hadnâ€™t arrived to take him to the hospice. A staff member told his wife that they had just checked and that there were no ambulances available as they where all on call and he would have to wait until the following morning.  
The next day, once again after waiting sometime his wife had to go and inquire about the ambulance to take him to the hospice and again she was told that there were no ambulances available as they where all on call and he would have to wait until the following morning.  
The nurses said they would re-book the ambulance for the following morning. When the next morning came it was the same response - no ambulances available. Three days in a row!  
The nurses then told his wife that it would be another 5 days before they could move him to Newry Hospice, thus expecting her to lie on the floor of her husband's room for a further, 5 days. Thus causing further anxiety by being separated from their children.  
His father went to Craigavon hospital in an attempt to get some answers as to what was going on. When he asked the nurses who the head nurse was, they claimed not to know.  
Out of sheer desperation to try to alleviate the suffering of his son and family he said he would have to take the matter to the Nolan Show.  
Meanwhile I rang the hospice in Newry on the 3rd day the ambulance didn't arrive to ask what was going on as Craigavon Hospital was not responding.  
The Newry Hospice told me that an ambulance was not booked on any of the 3 days we were expecting it.  
The hospice informed me that a senior staff member at Craigavon Hospital claimed they would personally book him an ambulance so that he would be moved to Newry Hospice the day after.  
After my intervention he was finally moved to the hospice on the Thursday. On the following Monday, the very day Craigavon Hospital had claimed that he would be transferred, he passed away. Thankfully due to my intervention he was able to spend his last few days in dignity with his family around him.  
Given the fact that he only had a short time to live and the situation was obviously very stressful for him, his wife, children and extended family why was he treated so poorly? Surely it was a simple task to book an ambulance to take him to a hospice where he along with his wife and two children could spend the remaining days he had left together in a family room?  
Why did the staff give false information? If any of the staff had taken the time to check in regards to an ambulance booking they would have seen no ambulance had been booked, but to come back and say they had checked and they were all busy seems nothing less than dishonest.  
We are all aware of the stresses that the NHS is currently facing but to treat a dying man and his family so poorly cannot be excused. Human error can also not be given as an excuse as the same error could not possible have occurred on three consecutive days.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Great practice and its good practises
body: I have always found the gps helpful and pleasant but to have a text  sent to me when I left a message about having tested positive for covid is both kind and extreme;y helpful.  Feeling very miserable about a new positive test result only 4 months after being extremely ill with my first attack I left a message for my GP that it had started again. That afternoon I received a text which expressed sympathy and good wishes for a full and speedy recovery from my GP .  A thoughtful helpful thing to do in these strange times where all we hear is that our gps dont care for us in many obvious and some unseen ways. I am happy to report his good wishes worked.  I feel so lucky to be a patient of this practise,

author: Johnny P
title: Sadly, at the end of my stay, my experience changed.
body:
I had a crisis that resulted in 48 hour stay at the Decisions Unit at the Longley Centre. The staff there were very kind and supportive in the de-escalation of my crisis. I can't thank them enough.  
Sadly, at the end of my stay, my experience changed. I was assessed for the home treatment team by two workers. One was very angry and condescending and questioned me in an aggressive police interview fashion. It was overbearing and intimidating. Because I had drank more alcohol than normal on two occasions in the weeks preceding the crisis, I was subjected to a barrage of questions that implied that I was an alcoholic (which I am not, though had difficulties in the past) and was not given sufficient opportunity to collects my thoughts for an appropriate response to contextualise and frame my answers (I was very depressed and feeling very vulnerable). Since I was not in the frame of mind for an argument, I felt the need to lie in order to agree to her questions, confirm and validate her opinion. This was in order to end the session as quickly as possible.  
Part of the assessment included questions on abuse. I answered these honestly and truthfully. Since I have experience of this, I was hoping that a sensitive response would happen. I was to be utterly disappointed. A quick acknowledgement as if it didn't matter. I felt utterly dismissed and unimportant.  
I feel as if I was treat as someone who had done something utterly shameful and abhorrent. I felt belittled, treated as a naughty school child and the session ended with me close to tears, utterly dejected and despondent. The other worker was very quiet, appearing to be disturbed and upset by what they had witnessed.  
The experience left me feeling numb for a day or two, though later that week, I was so filled with guilt and shame, I self-harmed, with an overwhelming feeling as if I had no right to ask for help, receive support or indeed to live.  
I have since received excellent support from others in the home treatment team. They're dedication, patience and sensitivity is highly commendable.  
I have served the trust as a public governor, I have dedicated many hours of voluntary service to the organisation. I am a mental health professional myself. I am aghast and angered greatly by this behaviour. I still burst into tears, thinking about it. What I wished to say was completely dismissed or twisted to fit that person's narrative.  
I hope notice is taken and that it it will not happened again. No one, let alone some one vulnerable should be spoken too in that manner. I self harmed, others may do something more catastrophic.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Endocrine patient
title: Wonderful service provided to endocrine patients
body:
I have met Jo on two occasions now when being brought to the unit for endocrine tests.  
I was having a oral glucose tolerance test over a two hour period to rule out pituitary tumour. Although a healthcare professional myself I was understandably nervous, however I was immediately met with a welcoming smile by Jo, the specialist endocrine nurse. Jo introduced me to a student nurse called Molly who was shadowing her that day and also George the FY1 doctor; both also very welcoming.  
Jo talked me through the procedure and made sure I fully understood why the tests were needed and what any results would potentially indicate. I felt very reassured that I was in safe hands with Jo and George. Itâ€™s very obvious that Jo cares for her patients and wants them to be as comfortable and relaxed as possible. Jo also took the time to explain things to student nurse Molly so that she also could gain some learning experience. George was also a wonderful doctor and made sure that I was comfortable and feeling ok each time he needed to take more blood.  
The service that Jo provides to endocrine patients is a credit to Stepping Hill Hospital and I was extremely grateful to have had such wonderful professionals providing care to me. Thank you ðŸ˜Š

title: Difficulty to get an appointment
body: Anytime I need an appointment I find it nearly impossible. And then when I do get through I get told the same thing, ring at 8.15, try the online consultation. Which is what I have been doing. However its either hold for nearly 90 to 120 minutes to be told there is no appointments. So I'm in a cycle of a no win situation. And everytime I explain this I get treated like rubbish? Like I'm stupid and incompetent. I try my best not to even use the NHS because of the stress and anxiety it gives me. But in this situation I have no choice. Thanks for no help

readBy.name: NHS Bradford District and Craven CCG

author: H2A31
title: An amazing therapist and service
body:
I was overwhelmed by all my mental heath: having severe anxiety, agoraphobia, anhedonia and depression. In the past, being quite bad but I always felt like I wouldn't let it win, as time went on it got worse and alongside a very damaging situation, would put me in the darkest place of my life.  
I was stuck in such a bad cycle of not going out at all unless absolutely necessary, so neglecting my friends, family and partner. I struggled to travel, see anyone or do anything as everything was so overwhelming.  
I'd panic if someone knocked at my door, if I heard post through the letterbox or if someone called me as it was so extreme. So bad that I wouldn't even come out of my room or go downstairs, let alone go outside. This was after my mother sadly passed away - I'd been working but became her carer when she become seriously ill and in return loosing my job due to attendance: I then had all the responsibilities of a new unexpected house owner, grieving, looking after my younger brother and it all weighed down on my mental health and this is where I became stuck in a bad place.  
I doubted anything would change or get better but I was fed up of being in this situation so I sought help. I then began my therapy with Claire: I can't express how much our sessions together overall helped. Claire went well above and beyond to help with my situation. We realised the situation and discussed new routines, changes and tasks that were out of my comfort zone but small goals that were achievable, that would help me overall as the more I do them then the easier they will become, will be breaking my safety behaviours and cycle. Giving me useful tips such as: not listening to any negative thoughts and emotions, not letting them win and realising I can do anything.  
I started accomplishing my goals and getting so many feelings of accomplishment and positivity, realising even though I struggled with my mental health, being anxious and facing them is always a good thing thing as will make everything so much easier. As time went on and the more things I started to do, tasks completed etc, I started noticed myself changing, I didn't need to know the ins and outs of things anymore as I knew I can do it no matter what I faced, whereas before I needed to know everything so I could prepare and in return spend my time worrying.  
I started traveling more, seeing people and feeling more myself the more I did things, being more spontaneous, progressing and facing the things that before i wasn't, as before I was avoiding everything which gave me negative emotions instead of battling these situations and overcoming them, as before I always thought to myself "I cant", which we new was the first thing that had to be changed. I was doing things and being better with situations that we hadn't even spoke about facing or doing, I started naturally taking on my new spontaneous tasks and wanting to test and push myself, as knowing that the more I face and do then the more accomplishment and progress I would make. It felt like everything I was doing was changing my ways, thoughts and behaviours even if I didn't realise it.  
The sessions continued and the steps and tasks I was facing always seemed reasonable to where they seemed achievable, although there may have been more to the tasks over time, they always seemed the same sort of difficulty due to the progress I was making, it got to the point where I was shocked with how far I had become and I was doing things that had seemed near impossible at a time before my therapy started.  
I had rocky moments when I struggled and cancelled or my mental health was fighting me, but I knew that I wasn't going nowhere near where I began and that I will be always going forward no matter what, I would just try again and accomplish it. It's about not giving up and pushing towards going forward, knowing every step is progress, having faith in myself that I can do it, especially with all the evidence I've seen so far.  
Each session Claire would listen to how my week went, how I had accomplished my goals, talking about new steps I could take and giving me useful tips and advice to how to tackle them, listening and being sympathetic when talking about my situations. If there was something I struggled with that week or something didn't go as expected and was getting me down, we would talk about the situation and always come up with a solution. I felt like even if something bad had happened or didn't go as well as expected, it was never a bad thing as there's always a solution and it just means learning from it and doing it better next time.  
I cant say how much this therapy had helped me. I am extremely thankful for my therapist Claire and how helpful, supportive, caring, understanding and empathetic she has been. The amount of progress I have made alongside her guide is absolutely unreal and I'm so thankful for the help to get out of such a dark place, I honestly feel like the person I used to be now which I had thought was lost. I am so glad I had made this decision and wanted to make a change. I felt like the person dying to come out all this time was helped set free due to the guidance and support from Claire. I now feel able to successfully see my goals for the future and know that I have the tools available to tackle them all.  
Claire thank you so much again, you're an amazing therapist! Thank you Inclusion Thurrock for your services!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: pictorbc43
title: My Heart attack
body:
December 2021. Woke in the early morning with heartburn. Got up took medication, made a cup of tea and sat up for an hour. Went back to bed but unable to sleep as I had a discomfort in my left arm, no pain just a discomfort. Got up again but after another hour my breathing started to become laboured and loud. Woke my wife and asked her to test me for covid. Test was negative  
My wife dialled 999. I waited for more than and hour for an ambulance to arrive, which is not acceptable. The staff heard my breathing from the front door and were calming and professional. Despite 3 attempts to transfer me to the Royal Victoria Hospital (RVH). I was taken to the Mater. Having been assessed I was informed I had a heart attack and was to be urgently transferred to the RVH where they were waiting for me. That transfer didnâ€™t happen until early evening by which time I had missed my slot.  
[Very happy with 'Waiting time']

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: olly
title: Discharged and taken off all meds
body:
I was in hospital,on section 3.. the hospital sent me to Cygnet hospital,the other end of the country, yet they tried to help me. They could see I was pyschotic,even St George's who sent me there knew I was . Yet when they had a meeting,the MPFT support worker who didn't come to meeting but by zoom,said this wasn't his remit,he didn't deal with pyschosis,he would have to pass it over to pyschosis pathway .  
I was put on haloperidol and sent back to St George's hospital who discharged me, saying it was behavioural. my flat was a mess,it had been used by unsavoury people, it was in a disgusting state.  
As soon as they knew I was out, they were back round .I just wanted them to leave me alone.I overdosed and ended up in general hospital .The pyschiatric hospital had me back for a few days,they discharged me again, no help or support.On careplan it's put I have tablets and if I overdose that's my choice. When I did overdose, on haloperidol, and pain meds,ending up back in general hospital. Pysch hospital had me back in and took me off all my meds then sent me to the flat with no support. I overdosed again on pain meds, I was ill,scared off these druggies coming round taking my possessions,even my TV . I went to stay at family's house They couldn't cope, I was been weird, I wasn't right. I ended up back in hospital, they gave me dipheydramine.then kicked me out,I had no mobile,no house keys,no bankcard. They basically got the police to leave me on the street. I have had no help or support, after months of been on a section 3, sent to the other end of the country, then just sent back to the flat which was in a disgusting state .

links.id: somewhere safe for person to live
don't take person of all meds
don't keep blaming the person for their illness
get better staff and pay them a decent wage

author: interview7
title: Interviewing at Rampton
body:
As patients sat on the team leader interviews this week which we both enjoyed. We did 3 very long days. We would like to say a big thankyou to Kath & Dale for all their support during these.  
We would like to say a big thankyou to Helen, Clare, and Tich for coming to see us face to face for our feedback, this made us feel that our voice was heard and made us feel valued.  
It is great that we ask value and recovery questions which we hope leads to staff who have the right attitude and subsequently great for our care they give  
[Very happy with 'Involved in decisions']

author: piscespx43
title: Supportive, excellent service above and beyond
body: Consultant Dr Anna was excellent in supporting my adult son (who would never get round to doing this but did mean to) and provided him with evidence required extremely quickly and effectively, involved him in the decision making process around treatment and management and was an amazing communicator - thank you from both of us

title: It's a nice practice i
body: I was treated with respect and kindness in all the time and the doctor was so kind to me and I appreciate it and she was a very nice person and listened to me and helped me with some advice on what was wrong

title: Very good practice
body: I was seen on time and they were very professional and I felt relaxed through the procedure I would definitely recommend them

title: Great practice
body: I visited this practice twice, and I had a great experience both times. Staff is friendly and professional.

title: Lovely place and Staff
body: My wife passed away last week after along illness. I cannot thank the doctors and staff enough for the kindness and care she received during this time. Nothing was too much trouble to help her or me. Thank you all. St. James, you are brilliant.

author: geminiqy48
title: Long wait in ED with a 21-month-old
body:
So my daughter took a rash at minight. It wouldn't disappear under a glass, straight to A&E at 3.50am. Didn't get seen until 8am. 4 hours and 10 mins with a 21 month old. Difficult was not the word.  
The A&E is so cramped, people were coming in with fluid bags attached to them, not the environment you want your child being forced into. Coffee machine wasn't working. We had been waiting 3 hours and I went up and asked how much longer it would be, only to be told I don't know at the reception desk. Not a bit of care.  
When we finally did get seen by doctors in the children's hospital bit, staff were fantastic. Co Down needs another A&E for sure. Maybe rethink children coming in at night. How it can be more accommodating for them.  
I felt waiting times and environment were appalling for anyone, never mind children.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Well done
body: Had a diabetic foot check, some problems were found and sorted with an appointment at foot clinic and treated within days. Solved a painful foot problem. Well done

author: Daniw96
title: Unable to get information on referral for breast cancer
body:
My grandmother has been diagnosed with breast cancer recently. Itâ€™s spread to her lungs, so diagnosed through a lung operation at Nottingham City. The referral was supposedly sent back to Derby Royal last week, weâ€™ve heard nothing, unable to get in touch with the breast unit to see if they received the referral, they arenâ€™t answering the phone.  
The lung consultant is also unable to get anyone to call him back. Itâ€™s urgent and worrying, she feels like sheâ€™s getting more and more unwell and we are unable to find out whatâ€™s next. Sheâ€™s unable to speak to the GP, who is the only one that is trying to help, as she canâ€™t get past the receptionists.  
Iâ€™ve complained to PALS but so far havenâ€™t heard from anyone that actually might be able to help. Treatment has so far been appalling.

author: asteropepm47
title: Father's care
body: Just to say thank you to the hospital at home team for the exceptional care given to my father. The care experience given was outstanding. Very grateful to Dennis and his team

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Phototherapy Service Basford
body:
Excellent service at a local convenient location. Great to have a service in the community that is so flexible with timings. This allowed me to carry out work around my treatment.
I would certainly love to use this service again.

author: coordinationgd94
title: Counselling Service
body:
The Fern Centre was suggested to me after a cancer diagnosis, as I was struggling to deal with my diagnosis.
I was able to work my way through my emotions in a calm, caring and safe environment and i cannot thank the team enough for their help and support, not only for me but also for my husband.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

author: Molly13
title: Felt I was in good hands
body:
I was at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary the A&E today for the morning and early afternoon shift. I would just like to say the team on were excellent from the ladies at reception, to all the nurses I dealt with, and the excellent doctor.  
They were kind and cheery, explaining everything at every stage. I was very anxious but they helped me feel more relaxed that I was in good hands. Thank you to everyone who helped me.

title: If you're scared of an MRI.....
body: ...don't be - the world's nicest people work here. From Reception to the end, they answered my (many) questions and all the answers were better than expected! I wish I hadn't wasted time worrying and reading out-of-date info online, because the whole experience was so unexpectedly positive. My thanks to the whole team :)

author: Charliemc1888
title: My stay in MAU
body: I was taking seizures staff were amazing even though they are clearly understaffed and definitely underpaid not that I know how much they are paid but its definitely not enough

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mumofjacks
title: Inclusions level of support
body:
Basingstoke Inclusion has been amazing in supporting me with getting off the alcohol, using all the different groups they have to offer . The support worker has just been so amazing especially when things were really tough and I hit rock bottom, I was supported by the team throughout.  
They are still supporting me know, Iâ€™m not sure where I would be now without their help. Thank you ðŸ˜Š

author: Nurse RMN
title: Outstanding care in the busy day surgery unit
body:
Firstly the nursing staff were prompt to get me into the day surgery ward and paperwork and procedures completed quickly with staff friendly and informative and answered all questions asked.  
As a nurse myself (different discipline) I understand how difficult things can be when a ward is busy. All nursing staff were friendly, available and really pleasant. It felt like I was not inconveniencing them at all.  
I also noticed other patients reaction and treatment and as an observer all complimented and thanked the nursing staff for their care and treatment and nursing staff interacted incredibly well in a fast paced environment.  
I had a long wait but I understood why and nursing staff provided me with sudoku, crosswords and word finding pages to keep me occupied as I left my mobile phone at home. I really appreciated this and the interaction with the nursing staff and doctors who were also informative and incredibly helpful.  
From start to finish the ward staff and doctors provided in my humble opinion outstanding care and treatment, and if I could I would like senior management ward level and above, if they don't already, to know how great the team are and deserve lots of praise.

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

title: Cataracts
body: Fantastic had this procedure done yesterday. Staff are superb everything  is explained and all staff friendly. I would definitely recommend Spamedica

title: Practice  visit
body: Very understanding,helpful and sympathetic receptionist and doctor.Medical issues resolved quickly and efficiently. Thank you!

author: Golfersneeds
title: On my week long visit I had brilliant care
body:
I went into the hospital feeling poorly with breathing problems.  
I just wanted to say that from I went in until I came out the doctors and nurses were brilliant, very professional, all the staff even young nurses, probably not qualified, couldn't do enough for me. If it was to fix the bed or get a jug of water, nothing was too much to ask. I also noticed that some of them were doing serious hours, more than 13 hour shifts I counted.  
I found the food was outstanding, it was hotel standard, and in my case my food request was always correct, that was no easy task with constantly changing patients.  
I am home now and thanks to the hospital staff I feel brilliant compared to a week ago. So a big _thank you _to all the staff.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: jackpotkr75
title: My outpatient appointment
body: I saw two nurses slightly later than my appointment time, but this did not matter to me.  I felt very reassured after scans they had done efficiently on my side and lower back near kidneys. They answered my questions about the procedure very well in non medical language

title: Great care given
body: I was admitted with breathing difficulties and placed in ward 2.  The nursing staff were fantastic, really caring and supportive, they made me feel better just with their support and attention. Canâ€™t thank them enough.

title: Top notch
body: Arranged a slightly unusual repeat prescription by phone this morning. Really felt 'received' by the receptionist. Heart warming service; many thanks!

title: Excellent experience
body: I attended for two appointments, one to have my annual blood review and the other to see a doctor for follow up. The experience was excellent, the surgery very clean and fresh, both practitioners very friendly, knowledgable and caring of my needs and anxieties.

author: Georges Mammy
title: Most comfortable hospital stay ever even though I wasnâ€™t well
body:
I was admitted to Acute Receiving Ward 2 on an evening in late July 2022 after receiving great care in the Emergency Department.  
I was only on the ARU2 ward overnight but the care and compassion that I received exceeded any expectations particularly given recent press reports about short staff.  
As a Covid patient I expected to be left in a room alone given the risks. That wasnâ€™t the case. Staff from all levels came in and seen to me regularly. Iâ€™d like to commend one person in particular, Rhuari, who used his initiative and found me an icepack to cool me down. Unbeknown to him this was exactly what I needed for agonising neck pain I had due to fibromyalgia. His actions made my stay the best.  
Apparently they were short staffed that night. I would never have known. Care at all levels was outstanding. Thank you to everyone involved.

title: Superb service
body: Great efficient practise. The registration process was done very professionally and efficiently.  The teams I encountered  - medical secretary reception, nurses - were very friendly and caring. I felt in good capable hands.

title: Very helpful
body: I have always found all the staff, receptionists, doctors and nurses all very helpful. They have never failed me in any emergency or in times of need. Thank you all for your hard work

author: Beaney
title: Day procedure in omagh hospital
body:
I had a wee day procedure in Omagh in the DPU in July 2022. From start to finish I was made to feel at ease, friendly staff and they go above and beyond.  
Would just like to thank the nurses in theatre and recovery, and Mr Zawislak, for the care they provided. First class. I also couldnâ€™t leave without taking a cup of coffee lol. Well looked after.  
Thank you again.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: slideqb58
title: children's vaccination
body: My 6 year-old twins were vaccinated today at The Quay, Newry, Northern Ireland. One was feeling very nervous, but the two staff in charge were wonderful in guiding her through the process, suggesting vaccinating the red panda stuffy to help her. Very efficient and very professional - thanks!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: dodgydinners
title: Amazing staff despite the pressure in ED
body:
Attended A&E with my daughter as recommended by GP Out of Hours. The department was extremely busy, with 141 patients waiting when we arrived.  
Throughout the night, all staff were friendly, smiling, welcoming and focused on each patient. The staff who treated my daughter - Sam, Elaine and Peter - were fantastic, speaking to her directly, allowing her to be involved in decisions.  
Whilst we were waiting, there were several patients who kicked up a fuss. At no time did staff display anything but concern and compassion for these patients. I was impressed. What an amazing team of staff!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: GBrodie
title: Nurse helped my son with his nose bleed
body:
My son was playing football at Renfrew Leisure today and he has taken quite a bad nose bleed. He has ran to the area where the nurses are giving vaccinations and the lead nurse Jane has taken care of him, stopped the bleeding and cleaned him up.  
Iâ€™m ever so grateful for this ladies actions. Although my son knows what to do as he gets these quite regularly he told me he was so scared because I wasnâ€™t there, so I am ever so grateful to have a fellow nurse look after my boy when I couldnâ€™t. He said she was so lovely. Thank you so much Jane.

title: Excellent emergency department.
body:
Really impressed with the care I received at emergency department. It was so efficient and seamless the whole way through from booking in, to triage, to see the doctors, blood tests and review. I was in and out within 2.5hours. The care I received from every member of staff was excellent. The nurses, the doctors were all so knowledgeable and caring and showed so much genuine concern. They understood the seriousness and just dealt with the job in hand. They took really good care of me. It was completely faultless, and head and shoulders above other emergency departments in other hospital trusts. uclh is exemplary. 
The covid precautionary measures were really reassuring to see too, the masks and sanitiser at the door, the screened chairs etc. 
Thank you very much to all the amazing nhs staff at uclh emergency department who cared for me, really appreciate all you do for us.

author: lkg1994
title: Calm, professional and funny team for my labour and delivery
body:
I gave birth to a beautiful baby girl at The Royal Jubilee Belfast in late July. I had a lengthy labour following induction & required a trial of assisted delivery in theatre & subsequently a c-section.  
I am extremely thankful for the care and treatment I received, particularly while in delivery suite. The staff were so calm, professional, friendly & funny all rolled into one and really made a difficult experience into a positive experience.  
I want to specifically thank Claire, Kim & Anna (student midwife) for all their help. I also want to thank Alex who placed my epidural & was then present the next night with me in theatre. She explained everything so well & reassured me every step of the way.  
The rest of the team were also fab & working amazingly in what Iâ€™m sure is a pressured time within our NHS.  
Thank you again.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: JustSomeADHD
title: CBT to help deal with recently diagnosed adult ADHD
body:
I have recently completed a 12 week CBT course with Inclusion Thurrock and I wanted to share my story for the life changing experience that I have received.  
My journey with Inclusion started a couple of years ago. I had been off of work with stress, depression and anxiety and my symptoms were not getting any better. After lots of frustrated calls with my GP I contacted inclusion to see if they could help. I ended up getting put through to the clinical lead and actually broke down on the phone to them. They were the first person I felt actually listened to me and wanted to help. I had convinced myself that I had developed a personality disorder or had Bi-Polar, and they didn't dismiss this, they listened to me and then arranged for an assessment by the local mental health team. The result of which was a diagnosis of ADHD in December of last year at 40 years of age.  
I enquired about therapy with both my GP and Psychiatrist and didn't get anywhere with either of them, my psychiatrist actually doubted the benefits of non ADHD targeted CBT. I decided to come back to Inclusion with the diagnosis and see if CBT would be able to assist the medication, when it started. After quite a wait and a couple of group sessions I was assigned a therapist and arranged our first appointment. There was a large amount of scepticism, partly due to previous experiences and also due to my psychiatrist sowing a seed of doubt with someone not considered a specialist performing ADHD CBT. This all disappeared after my first meeting with the therapist arranged by Inclusion!  
I will struggle to put into words just how much my life has changed in the hands of them, but I feel I need to get this out there! I was a complete mess a little over 13 weeks ago. Depressed, anxious and feeling worthless. No job, arguing with my wife all the time and just flat out miserable and done with life. I had waited and waited for my assessment, diagnosis and finally my medication but without therapy nothing was changing. I had the tools but lacked the knowledge to use them.  
The therapy I received completely changed everything. It felt targeted, personal and actually changed my life week by week, to the point where I think I'm actually in the best place I've ever been, in my head. I gained confidence in myself and my abilities and was able to get back to work. Not just to any job either, back to a job that I had basically sworn to never go back to. I have only been back 2 months and have already received employee of the month and got a promotion. My relationship with my partner is so much better along with my relationship with my children. All of this wouldn't have been possible without the help I received from CBT with Inclusion Thurrock.  
Each week my therapist would listen as I rambled through what had been going on with me. All the while he was carefully listening and guiding me to where I needed to be, and it felt so natural too. My ADHD can make me put off things or try to get out of them but this never happened during my sessions with Inclusion. Each week I looked forward to our meetings and I didn't miss any that I could have attended, but didn't, which is quite a big thing for me.  
The work done at Inclusion Thurrock really does change lives, I have experienced it and it is honestly incredible. I'll never forget this experience and what it did for me, I can't thank my therapist enough for everything he's done for me and my family! Is it weird that I miss our meetings now they are over?

title: Lung Function
body: I visited my local GP surgery for a review of my suspected COPD and although the nurse confirmed that I had moderate COPD, I was delighted with her assessment, explanation and treatment of my condition. I was told that I had COPD for years and have been given an inhaler some years ago which never worked for me but I have now been given an inhaler which will last 24 hours and tablets which will break down the mucus, allowing me to breathe easier. Brilliant, very impressed with her performance and only wish that I could name her. Suffice to say that she was an expert on lung function and certainly knew what she was talking about. Thank you.

title: Great Service
body: Booked appt with GP that I had been putting off for a while, was pleased I went, was listened too,  came away with a plan and felt support was there going forward if needed.

author: HappyChops
title: Wisdom tooth removal, good experience
body:
I was referred to DDH pre-pandemic to have an impacted wisdom tooth removed. I had the surgery in May and just wanted to thank the staff there for a job well done! Dr Shepherd, and nurses Carolyn and Andrea were excellent and I felt in good hands from the start. Dr Shepherd told me everything I needed to know, answered all the questions I had, and they all generally put me at ease with their relaxed and friendly manner.  
I was given IV sedation which was fantastic; one minute I'm chatting about growing veg; the next thing I know it's over an hour later and I'm looking at my tooth! I had to fast beforehand, and this was the only thing I was really concerned about, as if I get anxious I can burn through a lot of energy and end up with a low blood sugar if I don't eat enough (I don't have any medical issue such as diabetes though). In the end, I got up very early and had some breakfast within the guidelines given, and this tided me over fine until my rice pudding back at home. I wouldn't have got away with just having a big tea/supper the previous night. Just throwing this in here in case anyone else has the same concern and feels like it's only them.  
I had no problems afterwards, just an understandably achy and stiff jaw. I underestimated how much it takes out of you, but should any of my remaining wisdom teeth put in a less than helpful appearance, I'd be happy to come back to "the dental" to get them out. Thanks again!

author: JordanM98xx
title: Long waiting times and people being seen before us
body:
My dad was sitting in A&E for 11 hours at Forth Valley Royal Hospital and was waiting to get seen by a doctor. An announcement came out on the 11th hour saying no one would be seen before 6am which would then take the total waiting time to 15 hours.  
This is a joke! I got speaking to a couple who had a young boy who was no bigger than 8 years old who had a head injury and vomiting every time he sat up and was in an hour before my dad which is unacceptable. I saw other people that came in get straight through, which is also a joke considering there were very sick and unhappy people waiting beforehand.  
Falkirk is getting let down big style by this and I would love for this to be taken seriously and further looked at if possible.

author: elephantct64
title: Came in for a top up on contraception
body:
Arrived for my appointment and was seen straight away. The nurse (Niki) was really polite and made me feel very comfortable.  
I have been coming to Stafford clinic for the past few years and never felt judged.  
Niki went through all the usual checks, did my blood pressure and weight. We had a lovely chat and she provided me with my contraception pills.

author: Insertnamehere
title: Unknown waiting times and no answers
body:
I am a survivor of childhood sexual assault. I do not know what mental health condition I have as I have been on a waiting list for a full assessment for over a year. Given my symptoms it could be PTSD, a dissociative disorder, a personality disorder, something causing psychosis, some combination of these, or something else entirely (I don't know I'm not a psychologist). Throughout the past year I have phoned in multiple times to find out where I am on the waiting list and how long it will take for me to get an assessment so that I can get a diagnosis to get the information needed to sort out some kind of treatment plan that isn't a sticking plaster.  
When I call I am told each time that I will likely receive an appointment for an assessment in three months time. This is obviously not true. How am I supposed to find out my position on the waiting list and get a realistic understanding of how long I will be waiting if vey time I get fobbed off?  
I was able to find some useful information the last time I called, apparently I was moved to the waiting list for the emotional wellbeing service. I still don't how long I will have wait to find out what is wrong and what the most appropriate treatment would be.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Phone first--Very good
body:
I was at first unhappy as I didn't know they were only taking phone bookings from google. They will have a busy signal for a while but keep calling if you don't get through, once you're on the line it doesn't take too too long to talk to someone. They then will set up a telephone consultation--same day here for me!

Once having the consultation they were very straightforward and helpful--I got a treatment plan and tons of information to work from. I am feeling better only after one day with the prescription. I am really happy with this urgent care service.

title: Great practice
body: Iâ€™ve been dealing with the doctors surgery over the last few months and theyâ€™ve been so helpful sorting out what I need I would highly recommend the surgery to any of my family and friends.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff here are excellent but a&e needs looking at
body:
I came in through Accident and emergency, I have to say I would expect it to be a lot better, not on the staff behalf. The way it is run is not right, you cannot predict how many is going to be there and what they might have, as it scared me as I am immunosuppressed.  
The staff there were the best I have to say, they were very well- mannered.  
Female surgical has been good, they take great care of me. I have been on renal most of the times I am here so it is different being on a different ward. Dr Graham and Dr Keenan up there are the best. The environment here has been fine, they keep the place clean and tidy.  
The staff here are excellent, they are the best. They make sure to check on you regularly.  
The only thing I would change would be A&E, although I do not exactly know what can be done.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: A nice place to go.
body: This seems to be a very popular practice. I have just moved here and I had a thorough check up with the nurse. I was introduced to the Practice Manager who gave me all the info on the practice. She did explain that they are experiencing high call volumes but there is an email contact form on their website. You just fill it in and it gets sorted straightaway. Good job Thank you

title: Great Carr
body:
I got an appointment same day & it was on time
I was happy with the doctor & my consultation we had a discussion & agreed how to proceed to come to a suitable diagnosis

title: Everybody so helpfulâ€¦â€¦.always
body:
This really is a brilliant surgery, everybody so polite and helpful.
Those that are registered here,are indeed,fortunate.
And so helpful when I ask for a print out to be forwarded to another team.

title: Great Practice
body: Staff are very helpful and go out of their way to help. They provide excellent customer service and communication. Don't let other people put you off because of their bad experience. I recommend the staff for helping difficult patients.

title: Fantastic care
body: I had a hip replacement in June at Leavington Ward and wanted to say thank you. I received great care both from the ward staff and the surgery team (especially a lovely nurse in the pre op room who made me feel so calm about the spinal anaesthetic) .  What a great team. Always someone around to help and even though they were busy I was made to feel that I mattered. Thanks again.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant
body: Nice Young Ladies fitted me with New Phonak Hearing Aids with Volume Control and Bluetooth.  Connection to iphone also with myPhonak app to control volume and Pairs ok with Amazon Fire Stick. Now looking to get Bluetooth device for TV. Brilliant job thank you very, very much.

title: Great Service
body: This was my second visit to the hospital recently. Different department but once again  I found the consultant very thorough and extremely pleasant. Felt very comfortable in his presence. I will be seeing him again so wonâ€™t be nervous knowing I will be in good hands. Itâ€™s a shame I donâ€™t get the same from another department I have to attend. Also the nurse who took my blood pressure was a very nice young man.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Bowenâ€™s
body: I came in saw a really nice Dr for the first time she was really good and after her getting a second opinion she sorted me a hospital appointment which is nxt week she was very professional and I felt at ease the minute I saw her well done on a excellent recrniiment

title: Made to feel at ease
body: Thorough and easily understood diagnosis of my problems and treatment forthcoming, cannot say how lucky I feel having this level of service in these stretched times.

title: Exceptional surgery
body: I have been registered at this practice since I was young. I am very happy with this surgery. I work and I get to see the doctor in the evenings and I am very happy. The reception are fantastic especially very understanding that I work and always accommodate my needs, never have a problem to get through on the phones. They always sort medication out without any hassle. The surgery looks very clean, I came a few days ago and the doors are always open and the receptionist is always welcoming. The doctors are so good have time for you and they never rush you.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Always enjoyed visiting this practice as everyone do professional and helpful. The new renovations to this practice are stunning. Well run practice and the assessability is great,

title: Fantastic
body: From booking to appointment. Everyone I dealt with was professional and friendly. MRI was quick and staff informed me what would happen through the MRI

title: Great response and care
body: Today I needed to phone for advice/appointment. My call was answered quickly and I was given an urgent triage call. This led to an appointment within an hour and extremely kind and caring support from the doctor. An ECG was arranged for the afternoon. I cannot fault the way I was treated and the help I received. Thank you all.

title: Helpful telephone service
body:
Today I had cause to call the surgery regarding a prescription. The lady I spoke to was very helpful and respectful of my query. 

I feel confident that my issue will be resolved.

title: Review of prescriptions
body: Very thorough and helpful suggestions.  Enabled me to look at my situation right now. Also felt relaxed and confident in what had been suggested

title: Fantastic Team
body: I had a hysterectomy, the team on Ward E, have been absolutely fantastic, lovely and friendly, made sure we as patients had the things we needed, took the time to explain our care plans, canâ€™t thank them enough

readBy.name: Southport and Ormskirk Hospital NHS Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I made a phone call to book a nurse appointment. I was on hold for 4 minutes. The receptionist was friendly and helpful. She answered all my questions fully. I am very satisfied with this service.

title: A superb experience.
body: My son rang 111 to ask for help for me. Within minutes I was called by the service and the person who called me told me an ambulance was on the way.  She remained with me, establishing I was no worse until two paramedics walked into my bedroom. They began immediately to try to establish the problem and patiently and kindly continued with various investigations.  Eventually they decided I needed to be admitted to hospital and managed to take me safely down the stairs in a chair and into an ambulance.  They cared for me until I was admitted.   I was amazed at their range of skills and competencies and told them so.  From admission to Barnet Hospital to discharge that evening, that experience of quiet care, concern and competence was the same on the part of every member of staff who looked after me.  Nothing was done without my permission being sought first. I was, and am deeply grateful to them all and hope I told them so..

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing doctors
body: The GP the surgery is really good. The surgery really improved over the years and has a modern look. The reception staff are very friendly and always cooperating to give urgent appointments. They have made a new building meaning room for more appointments.

title: Receptionists are kind, friendly and helpful!
body: Doctors' receptionists tend get a bad press but I've always been super impressed by the attitude of those who work at Whiteladies Medical Centre.  This morning I telephoned the practice and got great advice and assistance from the person who answered the telephone. I then accompanied my son to a doctor's appointment and observed the young woman on the front desk. She was unfailingly polite, patient and helpful to everyone who came to the front counter, particularly elderly, sometimes confused patients. It makes such a difference - if only all receptionists were so pleasant. I hope the practice doctors appreciate the receptionists and know just how much better patients feel when staff display a positive attitude.

title: Brilliant practice
body: Not knowing what to expect I was pleasantly surprised at the attention and care shown to me. Procedures were explained in detail and great care was shown to me while carrying them out,and my vision is so improved I can't thank Spamedica enough, a big thumbs up from me Marjorie Unwin

title: Wonderful Helpful People, Thank You !!
body:
Thank you to everyone at Woodcote Medical Purley.  Always there to help, even when they are super busy.  Wonderful doctors, and really lovely reception staff who always have the time to help, reassure and advice.
You all make a difference in improving our lives, despite at times having very challenging work , you are always there for us.
Thank you most sincerely.

title: Great experience
body: Received a telephone call from a doctor after requesting an appointment using the online system. It was not rushed and I was given time to talk about my concerns and I am very happy with the service I received today. The staff are all very nice and helpful, including nurses and receptionist.

title: Great care
body: I was in a and e on 21/07/2022 there was a wait of 7/8 hours I can not fault the way I was dealt with   Eventually at 8 at night I was admitted to c44 where the staff were so caring.  the doctor I saw was brilliant and explained I had a scan which showed a kidney infection.  I was then transferred to ward d40 The care on this ward was second to none.  Nothing was a problem to the sisters, nursers and auxiliary staff.  The young and old staff all gave excellent care.  The doctors who came to see me explained everything and if I had any questions they answered me professionally and in terms I could understand I would like to pass on my thanks I am so grateful to each and everyone

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very efficient
body: Having recently joined the practice I needed some medication, contacted the surgery by phone and was called back within 30 minutes and my request was processed, Excellent

title: Appalling
body:
Took my son here with an injury. Waiting time was long. Numerous people entered after my son, were seen, treated and left.
I asked at the reception how long it would be and I explained that he was in a lot of pain and we were told he was next. He wasn't next and other people who came in after us were seen first.
Eventually he was seen and referred directly an x-ray. This was done quickly. Then we were sent back to the waiting room.
While waiting I saw three adults go in for xrays. All were seen before my 9 year old son who was on pain, with a broken finger if turns out.
I am appalled that a 9 year old child in pain with a broken finger kept being put to the back of the queue and left sitting so long in pain.
The staff were friendly but the system here is seriously flawed and not fit for purpose.

title: Receptionist was rude
body: I was booked an urgent care centre appointment after falling ill the night before, 111 had phoned and booked this, I turned up on the 31st July to be greeted by a very rude receptionist, she was an oldish lady with no manners, not approachable, and just rude, she spoke to me like I was stupid, I was already feeling very anxious about being there, do not get into healthcare if you are unable to show simple compassion. For someone who also works for the NHS I would not dream of talking to someone the way this receptionist did, I realised soon enough it wasnâ€™t just me it was everyone who came into the urgent care centre she greeted them appallingly.On the other hand the nurse practitioners and all other staff were fantastic I was seen and treated in a quick time frame and they shown no end of compassion so thank youâ˜ºï¸

title: No Complaints
body:
Both my husband and I have nothing but praise for Billesdon Surgery, even over the last two years during the Coronavirus Epidemic. The staff have always been helpful and polite.
We have both had hospital appointments during this time which have been arranged by the surgery, and follow-ups . They always keep us informed , usually by telephone and we have no complaints whatever.

title: What Practice????
body: What on earth is happening to our once reliable doctors, its very unnerving trying to get appointments, prescriptions, using the phone when your deaf is difficult that is when you can get through, no wonder our hospitals are struggling if theyre having to pick up patients who cant make contact with the surgeries

title: Acceptable visit but improvements inâ€¦
body: I visited the gynae department following a 2 week wait referral by my gp.  The most important thing to say is there was no signage to the reception desk.  In fact,  I never found it but just gave my name to a random member of staff who told me where to wait.  The lack of signage may seem a minor issue but this is a very basic requirement for a hospital full of stressed patients and relatives! Its absence prevented me from asking questions about what to expect.  I was then asked by a nurse to empty by bladder - which I didn't because it was already empty and I was drinking a mug of water at the time - and the next thing I knew I was in a room with the nurse, a consultant and 1 other person who didn't introduce themselves.  They were all pleasant and helpful but I was left feeling how much less stressful it would have been to have had better communication, especially as I was feeling unwell for an unrelated reason.  For anyone visiting imminently, go straight through the D zone doors (two sets) and at the reception/waiting area - with an unmanned desk with computer/printer/phone -  go through the doors on the left and the reception is supposedly somewhere immediately on the left.  I hope there a signs for my next visit!

title: Ignores your wishes
body: Went down to reception to make an appointment, was told I had ring for one went home and tried to book an appointment over phone for a face to face, explaining to receptionist again I do not want a telephone consultation as I am hard of hearing, was told someone will ring me that evening.....just what part of face to face do they not understand?

title: Appalling
body: Trying to get an appointment to see an actual Doctor at this practice is nigh on impossible, their telephone appointments scheme is asbysmal, you are kept waiting and waiting and waiting only to be told to try tomorrow

title: Started well
body: I couldn't fault this practice until Covid came along. Since then getting an initial face to face appt with a GP isn't an option. The majority of other practices have reverted back to initial face to faces so why aren't you? Secondly, the new building for the practice is coming along nicely, I only hope for the patients sake it isn't going to become Stonefield St & Milnrow Village Practice call centre.

title: First class
body:
This is a review of my visit to the Endoscopy department (sorry, this was not in the list of options).
From the minute I arrived to the time I left the service was first class.
My appointment was at 08:45am and I was home within two hours with no waiting.
The team clearly explained everything to me and were very professional at all times.
The unit itself was very clean and very well organised with everybody working well as a team (from my perspective), I felt in safe hands.
I have had a colonoscopy with a private hospital and in my opinion this was a better experience.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant
body: I am lucky with my health, not requiring much interaction with our surgery but I cannot rate them highly enough when I have. The Nurse was wonderful and advised me to make an apt with a Gp. I called on Tuesday speaking to an incredibly polite member of the team on the phone and given a tele apt for today - Thurs, basically within 48 hours - fantastic service. The Gp called me just earlier. Polite, approachable, professional and friendly was my experience and I do not feel that fully gives the credit due. Actually talking to a Gp who not only listens to you but engages with you in a caring natural way is outstanding and a real testament to the outstanding quality of care She and her team obviously strive to give and succeeds in my opinion. Being able to ask questions was so appreciated. Thank you doctor for your time today I genuinely appreciated it, also to your team (The internet doctor is so overrated as we discussed). Ms 28/7/22 08:50 phone apt. (I am unable to leave names of the nurse or the Gp as the review site doesnâ€™t allow - but you know who you are.)

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Diabolical
body: Called 111 and was advised to take my 4 month old baby to the urgent treatment centre immediately. We had to take her to a&e as urgent treatment was shut. That was fine. but we then waited for over 7 hours in a&e with a very young baby that couldnâ€™t breathe properly. Eventually we asked for a self discharge form as we felt it would be faster to book an app with our gp as it was opening shortly and theyâ€™re fantastic. They assured us we would be seen shortly and the urgent treatment centre was opening in 20 minutes and we would be the first to be seen. I have now been sat in the urgent treatment centre for an hour waiting for my appointment while everyone come and goes. Genuinely disgusted by the poor communication, sub par service and lazy attitude of some of the employees. Mainly the receptionists I might add. Please understand that a good portion of the employees are genuinely hard working but some do not posses the empathy required.  If this is where my extra national insurance is going then Iâ€™m better off on the dole. Avoid at all costs and while Iâ€™m at it 111 is Tom Hank as well.

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: No care, impossible to contact
body:
I dont understand how this practcie operates. It provides no care for the brockley community and in my opinion will cause a lot of harm to those registered. You cannot book online, they do not pick up their phones. I have stood in the waiting room watching the phone ring non stop with 3 reception/staff present and none of them picked up. Itâ€™s a hopeless system
Which prohibits access and needs a complete overhaul - staff and technology.

title: line is busy
body: i have been calling the surgery from 8 am until 8.50am the line so busy. i can't even go the surgery as they do not see patient on the desk

title: Disgusting phone system
body:
I don't leave reviews very often especially negative ones but i feel this practice deserves my full attention.

Since my local practice as merged with Denholm and Thornton affinity care it most certainly has taken a dive downhill its almost imposable to get to speak to someone and getting an appointment is so difficult since the merge.

I am a lorry driver and most of the time i cannot sit around at 7:59am with finger on redial so therefor trying to get an appointment is so frustrating.
Sorry for all the negative feedback but that's how i and everyone i speak to who go to the same practice feel.

title: Good practice under pressure
body:
Have always found this practice to be helpful and the doctors giving you time to explain your issue/s.
Yes, I can be difficult getting an appointment, especially on a Monday morning, but that's when most people are calling.

title: Poor
body: Absolutely poor practice. I have been trying to get an appointment for my daughter for several months now and her situation isnâ€™t getting any better. I contacted today and listened to the message 21 times and kept getting cut off. I then checked the reviews and found another number but by that point no appointments left. I canâ€™t even book her a routine appointment. Disgusting
